page.title: 15The Lions Carnival Beverley
page.content: On Saturday the 6th.July,1985 sixty-three floats paraded through Beverley streets,because it was the Lions Carnival which has taken place for twenty-one years. The Swinemoor Parent teachers Association met in Morton Lane car park along with everyone else for the judging. We did, {'Bugsy Malone in the Swinemoor {Speakeasy' All the girls wore 1920's style dresses,and the boys wore dark clothing with a large brimmed trilby. The girls were seated at tables with cocktail drinks. Boys had imitation guns and one boy pretended to be dead. We drove through the historic streets of Beverley;Wednesday Market,Saturday Market and Hengate. The judges awarded us a first prize.
